messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:56): it seems the Chrome team is set on beating our version number :-)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (11:56): They could just pull a slackware
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:58): is there any element name remotely similar to <figcaption>?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:59): well, they're the other way around
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:00): keygen is the other way around
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:00): optgroup is basically the same thing
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:01): Are you tempted to remove it from w3c HTML5 just so it can be added later when <legend> is viable? :P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): never though i'd see that many complaints about doing something shelley asked for so quickly
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:02): Only because you did it voluntarily
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:02): You have to wait for the WG decision
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:04): personally i'd rather drop them both too until <legend> works
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:04): yeah me too but too many people want them now

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:05): next time i think of adding something like this i'll make sure it really works, parser-wise, before adding it, since it's easier to keep something popular out than to remove it later.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:05): yeah, and it's pretty costly at the price of two new elements :/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:06): feel free to raise an objection :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:06): but i think there's no chance of either <legend> or removal being a WG decision
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:06): still, at least we can point to this as proof the WHATWG is trying to cooperate :-)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:07): Just find another w3c technology that predates details and does the same thing :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:07): still doesn't see why making a new element name is worse than overloading an existing name to have different meanings depending on context
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:08): I wonder if the chairs thought of the consequences for html5-diff when they started making things complex

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:08): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: having four element names for legends instead of two makes it twice as hard to know which to use when you are in a situation where you need to use one
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:08): Maybe I should just define [HTML5] in html5-diff as the WHATWG copy :p
